basics.name: Thomas Quettier
basics.summary: Cognitive neuroscientist and clinical psychologist specializing in facial motor control, sensorimotor integration, and emotion recognition. Registered psychologist in Italy, experienced in TMS, EMG, EEG, and behavioral paradigms. Advocate of open science and contributor to PsychoPy development.

publications.name: Finger posture modulates structural body representations
publications.summary: Investigates how finger posture affects the brain’s structural representation of the body.

publications.name: Blocking facial mimicry during binocular rivalry modulates visual awareness of faces with a neutral expression
publications.summary: Facial mimicry influences visual awareness during binocular rivalry, suggesting embodied contributions to face perception.

publications.name: Testing EEG functional connectivity between sensorimotor and face-processing visual regions in individuals with congenital facial palsy
publications.summary: Examines EEG-based functional connectivity in individuals with congenital facial palsy to assess sensorimotor contributions to face processing.

publications.name: In and Out of Consciousness: A method to study the temporal evolution of consciousness during binocular rivalry
publications.summary: Introduces a novel method for tracing the temporal dynamics of conscious perception during binocular rivalry.

publications.name: When mind and body align: examining the role of cross-modal congruency in conscious representations of happy facial expressions
publications.summary: Explores how tactile-visual congruency enhances conscious access to emotional facial expressions.

publications.name: Individual differences in intracortical inhibition predict action control when facing emotional stimuli
publications.summary: Links individual differences in intracortical inhibition to behavioral action control under emotional challenge.

publications.name: Silicon Spike: An Arduino-based low-cost and open-access triggerbox to precisely control TMS devices
publications.summary: Presents an open-source, low-cost Arduino-based triggerbox to synchronize TMS with millisecond precision.

publications.name: Facial expressions selectively modulate P300 somatosensory evoked-potential, but emotional scenes do not: Electrophysiological evidence for sensorimotor simulation
publications.summary: SEPs reveal sensorimotor modulation by facial expressions, not scenes, supporting simulation over emotion reactivity.

publications.name: Early changes in corticospinal excitability for subliminally presented fearful body postures
publications.summary: Demonstrates early motor suppression in response to subliminal fearful bodies, supporting rapid action preparation.
